title: Do transfer students get scholarships? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes. Nowadays there are very few merit scholarships, practically none: almost all financial aid is need driven. If you already have a scholarship, it can often be transfered. If you have financial aid, more than likely it cannot be transfered but if you were eligible before there is a very good chance we will still be eligible. Nothing like a few phone calls to discuss financial aid possibilities though. Good luck!

At MIT and most if not all of the elite Private US universities, there are no merit scholarships but all transfer students are eligible for financial aid up to and including Full financial aid. You and all of your parents will need to fill out the daunting FAFSA (if US) forms and the CSS Profile forms (everyone). NOTE: 85% of those forms or more is for your Parents. Speak with them. Good luck.
As long as you meet the criteria in the receiving school, scholarships are continued. For more information Google the names of the sending and receiving schools for scholarships when transferring.
